did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Medieval and Early Rennaissance Manuscript Collection, 1250-1550
did.physdesc: One 1/2 Hollinger box, one flat box; 1.88 linear feet
did.abstract: Consists of ten manuscript leaves created during the Medieval and Early Renaissance periods. The items are housed in one 1/2 Hollinger box and one oversize flat box.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], the Medieval and Early Renaissance Manuscript Collection, 1250-1550, SC# 2007, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Nine leaves were purchased in 2009 and another was purchased in 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: This collection may receive accurals of other manuscript leaves.

processinfo.head: Processing Notes
processinfo.p: The items digitally represented here were created by photographingwith a Canon Rebel XT with a Sigma 50mm lens piecing large images in Adobe Photoshop and magnifying them with Zoomify Express, then creating and linking the pages from which to serve them on the finding aid. Project staff included Julia Merkel (photography and piecing), Tiffany Cole (magnifying),Tracy Harter (page creation/linking), and Gabe Camut (page creation/linking).

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Because this is an artificial collection, a historical note is not applicable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Medieval and Early Rennaissance Manuscript Collection, 1250-1550, consists of ten manuscript leaves created during the Medieval and early Rennaissance periods, in Latin, commissoned by the Catholic Church. The items are housed in one 1/2 Hollinger box and one oversize flat box.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the order in which items were acquired.
